name: Barotex Technology Corporation
overview:
Barotex Technology Corporation holds an exclusive license agreement to produce and distribute Barotex fibers and fabrics.

Barotex fibers are processed out of mineral rocks of volcanic origin through multiple confidential patented processes. The base fibers formulated with carbon or ceramic fibers and/or various metals have been developed into new hybrid composite type materials and technologies to open a new page in 21st Century fiber material science.

Depending upon the weave and composite material introduced into the fibers, Barotex can work as a replacement for conventional construction and manufacturing materials such as fiberglass, Kevlar, carbon fiber, steel, aluminum and wood in a wide range of applications.

Physical properties of Barotex Fiber include high strength, stability, moisture resistance, fire resistance, chemical resistance, electrically non-conductive, and low thermal conductivity.

Environmentally Friendly Characteristics include the fact that Barotex fibers are 100% Recyclable, non-petroleum based, sustainable to produce, and creates far less pollution when compared to today’s commonly used construction and manufacturing materials.

competitor.name: Lilo Ben Zicron, Chief Executive Officer
